001package squidpony.squidai.astar;
002
003import squidpony.Maker;
004import squidpony.squidgrid.Direction;
005import squidpony.squidmath.Arrangement;
006import squidpony.squidmath.Coord;
007
008import java.util.ArrayList;
009import java.util.Collections;
010import java.util.List;
011import java.util.Map;
012
013/**
014 * A convenient implementation of {@link Graph} for {@link Coord} nodes; this also allows constructing a Graph with a
015 * 2D char array like those produced all over SquidLib. Some predefined heuristics are available as static constants
016 * here. You can "show" a DefaultGraph in conjunction with a {@link Pathfinder}, which appends a big grid of node costs
017 * matching the Pathfinder to a StringBuilder.
018 */
019public class DefaultGraph implements Graph<Coord> {
020
021    /**
022     * A predefined Heuristic for Coord nodes in a 2D plane where diagonal movement is estimated as costing twice as
023     * much as orthogonal movement. This is a good choice for graphs where only four-way movement is used.
024     */
025    public static final Heuristic<Coord> MANHATTAN = new Heuristic<Coord>() {
026        @Override
027        public double estimate(Coord node, Coord endNode) {
028            return Math.abs(node.x - endNode.x) + Math.abs(node.y - endNode.y);
029        }
030    };
031    /**
032     * A predefined Heuristic for Coord nodes in a 2D plane where diagonal movement is estimated as costing the same as
033     * orthogonal movement. This is only suggested for graphs where eight-way movement is used, and it may produce
034     * erratic paths compared to {@link #EUCLIDEAN}.
035     */
036    public static final Heuristic<Coord> CHEBYSHEV = new Heuristic<Coord>() {
037        @Override
038        public double estimate(Coord node, Coord endNode) {
039            return Math.max(Math.abs(node.x - endNode.x), Math.abs(node.y - endNode.y));
040        }
041    };
042    /**
043     * A predefined Heuristic for Coord nodes in a 2D plane where all movement is calculated "as-the-crow-flies," using
044     * the standard Pythagorean formula for distance as in the real world. This does not make diagonal connections, if
045     * they are allowed, actually cost more or less, but they won't be preferred if an orthogonal route can be taken.
046     * This is recommended for graphs where eight-way movement is used.
047     */
048    public static final Heuristic<Coord> EUCLIDEAN = new Heuristic<Coord>() {
049        @Override
050        public double estimate(Coord node, Coord endNode) {
051            return node.distance(endNode);
052        }
053    };
054    /**
055     * A predefined Heuristic for Coord nodes in a 2D plane where the heuristic is not used, and all cells are
056     * considered equivalent regardless of actual distance.
057     */
058    public static final Heuristic<Coord> DIJKSTRA = new Heuristic<Coord>() {
059        @Override
060        public double estimate(Coord node, Coord endNode) {
061            return 1.0;
062        }
063    };
064
065    public static final List<Heuristic<Coord>> HEURISTICS = Collections.unmodifiableList(Maker.makeList(MANHATTAN, CHEBYSHEV, EUCLIDEAN, DIJKSTRA));
066    
067    public Arrangement<Coord> positions;
068    public ArrayList<List<Connection<Coord>>> allConnections;
069    public int width;
070    public int height;
071
072    /**
073     * Creates an empty DefaultGraph with capacity 16; you must call {@link #init(char[][], boolean)} or
074     * otherwise manually initialize this DefaultGraph before using it. The capacity is expected to resize to fit a
075     * typically-much-larger map.
076     */
077    public DefaultGraph() {
078        this(16);
079    }
080
081    /**
082     * Creates an empty DefaultGraph with the given minimum capacity; you must call {@link #init(char[][], boolean)} or
083     * otherwise manually initialize this DefaultGraph before using it.
084     * @param capacity how many nodes, approximately, to expect in the map
085     */
086    public DefaultGraph(int capacity) {
087        positions = new Arrangement<>(capacity);
088        allConnections = new ArrayList<>(capacity);
089    }
090
091    /**
092     * Creates a DefaultGraph and immediately initializes it using {@link #init(char[][], boolean)}, with eightWay set
093     * to false (only orthogonal neighbors will be connected).
094     * @param map a char[][] where {@code #} is used to mean a wall or an impassable cell
095     */
096    public DefaultGraph(char[][] map)
097    {
098        this(map, false);
099    }
100
101    /**
102     * Creates a DefaultGraph and immediately initializes it using {@link #init(char[][], boolean)}.
103     * @param map a char[][] where {@code #} is used to mean a wall or an impassable cell
104     * @param eightWay if true, this will try to connect diagonals as well as orthogonally adjacent cells
105     */
106    public DefaultGraph(char[][] map, boolean eightWay)
107    {
108        this(map.length * map[0].length * 3 >> 2); // 3/4 of the map could maybe be walkable; more is rare
109        init(map, eightWay);
110    }
111
112    /**
113     * Creates a DefaultGraph and immediately initializes it using {@link #init(double[][], boolean)}, with eightWay set
114     * to false (only orthogonal neighbors will be connected).
115     * @param costs a double[][] where negative values are blocked and any other values are the cost to enter that cell
116     */
117    public DefaultGraph(double[][] costs)
118    {
119        this(costs, false);
120    }
121
122    /**
123     * Creates a DefaultGraph and immediately initializes it using {@link #init(double[][], boolean)}.
124     * @param costs a double[][] where negative values are blocked and any other values are the cost to enter that cell
125     * @param eightWay if true, this will try to connect diagonals as well as orthogonally adjacent cells
126     */
127    public DefaultGraph(double[][] costs, boolean eightWay)
128    {
129        this(costs.length * costs[0].length * 3 >> 2); // 3/4 of the map could maybe be walkable; more is rare
130        init(costs, eightWay);
131    }
132
133    /**
134     * Initializes or resets the nodes this knows about and their connections to their neighbors. This can be called
135     * more than once on a DefaultGraph, typically when the map changes, and will forget its old nodes and only store
136     * the ones in the latest map. The {@code map} should use {@code #} for walls and impassable areas; all other chars
137     * will be considered equally passable.
138     * @param map a char[][] where {@code #} is used to mean a wall or an impassable cell
139     * @param eightWay if true, this will try to connect diagonals as well as orthogonally adjacent cells
140     */
141    public void init(char[][] map, boolean eightWay)
142    {
143        width = map.length;
144        height = map[0].length;
145        Coord.expandPoolTo(width, height);
146        positions.clear();
147        allConnections.clear();
148        for (int i = 0; i < width; i++) {
149            for (int j = 0; j < height; j++) {
150                if(map[i][j] != '#')
151                    positions.add(Coord.get(i, j));
152            }
153        }
154        final Direction[] dirs = eightWay ? Direction.CLOCKWISE : Direction.CARDINALS_CLOCKWISE;
155        final int size = positions.size(), dirCount = dirs.length;
156        for (int i = 0; i < size; i++) {
157            Coord c = positions.keyAt(i);
158            ArrayList<Connection<Coord>> list = new ArrayList<>(dirCount);
159            for(Direction dir : dirs)
160            {
161                Coord offset = c.translate(dir);
162                if(positions.containsKey(offset))
163                    list.add(new DefaultConnection<>(c, offset));
164            }
165            allConnections.add(list);
166        }
167    }
168
169    /**
170     * Initializes or resets the nodes this knows about and their connections to their neighbors. This can be called
171     * more than once on a DefaultGraph, typically when the map changes, and will forget its old nodes and only store
172     * the ones in the latest map. The double[][] {@code costs} stores the costs to enter cells; it is typically
173     * produced by {@link squidpony.squidgrid.mapping.DungeonUtility#generateAStarCostMap(char[][], Map, double)}.
174     * Negative values in costs mark cells that cannot be entered (like walls); 1.0 is used for normal cells that can be
175     * entered easily, and higher values mark more challenging cells to enter.
176     * @param costs a double[][] where negative values are blocked and any other values are the cost to enter that cell
177     * @param eightWay if true, this will try to connect diagonals as well as orthogonally adjacent cells
178     */
179    public void init(double[][] costs, boolean eightWay)
180    {
181        width = costs.length;
182        height = costs[0].length;
183        Coord.expandPoolTo(width, height);
184        positions.clear();
185        allConnections.clear();
186        for (int i = 0; i < width; i++) {
187            for (int j = 0; j < height; j++) {
188                if(costs[i][j] >= 0.0)
189                    positions.add(Coord.get(i, j));
190            }
191        }
192        final Direction[] dirs = eightWay ? Direction.CLOCKWISE : Direction.CARDINALS_CLOCKWISE;
193        final int size = positions.size(), dirCount = dirs.length;
194        for (int i = 0; i < size; i++) {
195            Coord c = positions.keyAt(i);
196            ArrayList<Connection<Coord>> list = new ArrayList<>(dirCount);
197            for(Direction dir : dirs)
198            {
199                Coord offset = c.translate(dir);
200                if(positions.containsKey(offset))
201                    list.add(new CostlyConnection<>(c, offset, costs[offset.x][offset.y]));
202            }
203            allConnections.add(list);
204        }
205    }
206
207    /**
208     * Returns the connections outgoing from the given node.
209     *
210     * @param fromNode the node whose outgoing connections will be returned
211     * @return the array of connections outgoing from the given node.
212     */
213    @Override
214    public List<Connection<Coord>> getConnections(Coord fromNode) {
215        return allConnections.get(positions.getInt(fromNode));
216    }
217
218    /**
219     * Returns the unique index of the given node.
220     *
221     * @param node the node whose index will be returned
222     * @return the unique index of the given node.
223     */
224    @Override
225    public int getIndex(Coord node) {
226        return positions.getInt(node);
227    }
228
229    /**
230     * Returns the number of nodes in this graph.
231     */
232    @Override
233    public int getNodeCount() {
234        return positions.size();
235    }
236
237    /**
238     * Given a StringBuilder to append to, a Pathfinder with Coord nodes that has run and at least attempted to find a
239     * path, and the {@link Pathfinder#metrics} that the Pathfinder must have been configured to record, this makes a
240     * textual representation of the explored nodes and appends it to the StringBuilder. This shows the actual costs of
241     * all explored nodes in the Pathfinder for its latest path. If you intend to show a DefaultGraph like this, the
242     * Pathfinder must be constructed with {@link Pathfinder#Pathfinder(Graph, boolean)} where calculateMetrics is true
243     * (or where {@link Pathfinder#metrics} was assigned {@code new Pathfinder.Metrics()} before calculating a path).
244     * This will vary in displayed width based on the maximum width required to print any node, so if the
245     * longest-distance node costs 100 to enter, the displayed width will be longer than if the longest-distance node
246     * only cost 99. Any unvisited nodes, including walls and out-of-the-way areas, will be shown with some number of
247     * '#' chars. Spaces will separate nodes on the same line.
248     * @param sb a StringBuilder that will be appended to and returned
249     * @param pathfinder a Pathfinder that must have at least tried to find a path (and must have metrics, see below)
250     * @param metrics the Metrics for the above Pathfinder, which are required to be non-null when the path was tried
251     * @return the StringBuilder, after appending what is usually a lot of text in a grid
252     */
253    public StringBuilder show(StringBuilder sb, Pathfinder<Coord> pathfinder, Pathfinder.Metrics metrics) {
254        int len = (int)Math.log10(Math.round(metrics.maxCost)) + 1;
255        for (int y = 0; y < height; y++) {
256            for (int x = 0; x < width; x++) { 
257                Coord c = Coord.get(x, y);
258                int index = positions.getInt(c);
259                Pathfinder.NodeRecord<Coord> nr;
260                if(index < 0 || (nr = pathfinder.getNodeRecord(c)).category == Pathfinder.UNVISITED) {
261                    for (int i = 0; i < len; i++) {
262                        sb.append('#');
263                    }
264                }
265                else {
266                    int cost = (int)(nr.costSoFar + 0.5);
267                    if(cost == 0)
268                    {
269                        for (int i = 1; i < len; i++) {
270                            sb.append(' ');
271                        }
272                        sb.append('0');
273                    }
274                    else {
275                        int used = len - (int) Math.log10(cost) - 1;
276                        for (int i = 0; i < used; i++) {
277                            sb.append(' ');
278                        }
279                        sb.append(cost);
280                    }
281                }
282                sb.append(' ');
283            }
284            if(y + 1 < height) 
285                sb.append('\n');
286        }
287        return sb;
288    }
289}
